args:
Crown Prince Leonidas suddenly appears in
command of Alex and her soldiers and reveals
that he was leading the oppression of
Valkaheim all along. Seeking Morsayati's
power, he heads deeper into the Forsaken
Way with the prince in hot pursuit.
Hmph. Were I to keep you alive,\nchurch doctrine would be eroded.
At the very least, there will be no\nsuffering, for I shall send you to stand in\nthe presence of the goddess Ilia! Haaah!
That's enough! We've already rescued\nall of the other believers.
We got ya surrounded, ya damn assassin!\nThere's nowhere to hide, so give it up!
All living creatures return to the dust.\nIf I cannot reclaim paradise, at least I\nmeet my end in the way of my choosing.
Do not rush to your demise, Alex.
You need not die in this place—and I\nwould not permit you to throw your life\naway so easily.
Ugh, that voice! I can just hear the\nbloodlust drippin' off it...
Your Highness, it's the Imperial Army!\nAnd that man leading them...
Poor fools. Did you not realize that this\nforsaken place is under my control?
You chose to leap into the fires of hell\nwithout even a passing glance, and now\nthe flames will feed on your judgment.
I know we haven't seen a lot of each\nother, but we met a few times in the—
Uh, so you guys AREN'T brothers?\n...I am so confused right now.
My siblings are numerous as grains of\ndust in the wind. You truly think I can\nremember each and every one of them?
There is but one among us who can\nclimb the ladder and inherit the throne.\nThe rest are naught but useless rabble.
I've never heard a man speak with\nsuch arrogance and disregard!
Still, that name... {player_name}.\nNow that I think of it, I may have once\nheard it whispered on the wind.

Tongues wag about a once-nameless
prince who set out from the capital and—
much as the Founder King before him—
became pactbound with multiple dragons.
We've heard that a large-scale disturbance\nhas broken out in Valkaheim, and that\ninnocent people are suffering.
We're here to lend you whatever help\nyou may need to see this right.
I know of no such disturbance.\nNo such suffering.
The acts of which you speak are merely\na purge of those who dissatisfy me.

Just so! For you see, Morsayati's power is
nothing to be abhorred—rather, it connects
us to the goddess, and will bring about
a glorious new providence.
Those who do not accept this truth\nmust be purged from the world.
Wait a sec. YOU started all the\nproblems in Valkaheim?!
Times have changed. Aurelius has fallen,\nand one of the great ancient demons has\nconstructed a glorious new Empire.

The Dyrenell Empire is not my enemy.
It is merely the forerunner of the new
era I seek—an era that will surpass
that of dragon worship.
This man will be no ally of ours,\n{player_name}.
Having said that, I am not so obsessed\nas to run about seeking out and\nexterminating non-believers one by one.

It was simply their misfortune that I
was coming to this place on this day.
The fact they sought refuge here was
mere happenstance—nothing more.
If you came all the way out to this place\nthere must be something that you're\nseeking in the depths.
Is that not obvious? I have a most\nsingular desire: Morsayati's power.
To be more specific, in this place sleeps a\npiece of the body of the Other—a part of\nMorsayati!
This place is yet another Binding Ruin,\nand the power within shall be mine!
I can't believe what I'm hearin' right now!
Believe it. I fear nothing—not dragon nor\ngoddess or even that which was responsible\nfor laying waste to the old world.
I will seize this power for myself and\nmaster it so I might open broader\nhorizons for all humanity.
Yet great advancements require sacrifice,\nand the aftermath could demand lives in\nthe tens of thousands.
Brother, if you're serious about this—
And what if I am? What shall you do?\nCall forth your pathetic dragons to do\nbattle with my own?
I am pactbound to the Blazewyrm—the\nmost powerful dragon in history! He alone\nreduced a hundredfold kingdoms to ash!
There was once a young male fire dragon\nwho had powers equal to my own.
His name was Mars. And if your brother\nhas formed a pact with him...
Right then! Let's take this fool out\nbefore he calls in the cavalry.
I'll not allow you to put even\none scratch on His Excellency!
He stands in support of our Church!
He has promised to return it to the\nglorious ways of old!
If you follow this man,\nwe will be able to—
Damn your eyes or open them, Alex!\nYou have become blind to Ilia's will!
I've done no such thing! I do this to\nreclaim safe refuge! I do this to—
This grows tiresome; I have weightier\nmatters to attend to than this bunch.
Come, Alex. I must obtain Morsayati's\npower as soon as I am able.
Okay. THAT was a deal. So what do\nwe do now, {player_name}?
Who knows what carnage could be\nunleashed if my brother got his hands\non a piece of Morsayati's body?
We need to put a stop to his ambitions\nby any means necessary!
And if we can do that, I'm certain\nAlex will see reason as well.
